audio_description: Today we’ll make a very popular and tasty Sindhi Biryani. It tastes great and is an easy recipe. Do watch the full video, and if you like it, don’t forget to like, share, and subscribe. So let’s begin.

audio_description: This is biryani masala. I used Suhana biryani masala here, but you can use any brand you have available. I added two heaping tablespoons. These are dried plums (Aloo Bukhara), which are essential for Sindhi Biryani.

audio_description: The rice comes out fluffy and separate. Add 2 bay leaves, 2–3 cloves, 2–3 black peppercorns, 2–3 green cardamoms, and 2 cinnamon sticks. Boil the water well before adding rice.

audio_description: Next, arrange tomato slices. Traditionally, thick green chilies are used which are not spicy, but I didn’t have them, so I used chopped regular ones. Add some coriander, mint, and the saffron we soaked earlier.

audio_description: Sindhi Biryani is ready! It’s a slightly different recipe but tastes absolutely delicious. Definitely give it a try. And as always, if you liked the recipe, don’t forget to like, share, and subscribe. That’s all for today—see you next time!
